issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Inside Fetcher.java there are a few cases where an error can happen and the corresponding map task is not marked as a fetch failure.  One of these is if the Shuffle server returns a malformed result.

MAPREDUCE-3992 makes this case a lot less common, but it is still possible.  IF the shuffle handler always returns a malformed result, but a OK response the Fetcher will never stop trying to fetch those results.
fields.summary: Potential infinite fetching of map output

comments.body: This patch adds in a test, and marks tasks failed on any error while trying to fetch the data.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12536897/MR-4423.txt

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core.

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

I determined what the problem was.  It was not that this patch is flawed, but it was exposing another transient issue that was committed recently MAPREDUCE-4384.

I did find a few minor issue with the previous patch that I have fixed in this one.
